meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling - where do I even start? As a grok (you know, one of those seasonal game reviewers with witty humor), I'm supposed to give you the lowdown on this fandisc. But let me tell you, folks, it's like trying to explain a warm hug to someone who's never had one before - it's just that good!

First off, these other critics are making me look bad! Like, NintendoWorldReport giving it an 80? Please, I'm the real deal, with my self-deprecating humor and all. And don't even get me started on Gamer Escape saying it should've been DLC - what even is that? A cop-out excuse to not have to write a real review?

Okay, okay, enough about those guys (I'll get to them later). Let's talk about the game! Sweet and Spicy Darling is like the otome version of a fine wine - you need to let it breathe, you know? You gotta play the original Cupid Parasite first (duh), but then this sequel will be like a symphony of feels. The improved text? More like a symphony of FLAVORS!

So, what's the game about? It's all about romance, baby! Six paths to choose from, each with their own unique storyline and... let's just say, endings. Good ones, bad ones - you'll feel like you're part of some ancient Greek or Roman drama (because, you know, the names).

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok, why should I care about this otome game?" Well, my friend, it's all about that artful uniqueness. This game is like a spicy kick in the pants - you don't know what to expect, but you'll be hooked. And if you're new to the series? No worries! The reminders are there for you to jump right in and feel the love (or whatever flavor you choose).

In conclusion... I'm not going to give my score away like those other critics did. You just have to trust me on this one - Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is a must-play (after playing the original, of course). And if you don't? Well, that's okay too; more for me!
